articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: Joe Biden meets Chinese president Xi Jinping for the last time as U.S. president on Saturday, but the leaders' goal of lowering tensions before Donald Trump's inauguration is challenged by fresh conflicts over cyber crime, trade, Taiwan and Russia.
articles.title: Biden, Xi set for tense final meeting in Peru as Trump era looms

articles.author: Saurabh Sharma
articles.description: Ten newborn babies died from burns and suffocation after a fire swept through a neonatal intensive care unit in northern India, a government official said on Saturday.
articles.title: Ten babies die in fire at Indian hospital's neonatal unit

articles.author: Kate Abnett, Valerie Volcovici
articles.description: The U.N.'s climate chief called on leaders of the world's biggest economies on Saturday to send a signal of support for global climate finance efforts when they meet in Rio de Janeiro next week.
articles.title: UN climate chief asks G20 leaders for boost as finance talks lag

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Leaders of the Group of Seven (G7) major democracies on Saturday reiterated a pledge to keep imposing severe costs on Russia for its invasion of Ukraine, through sanctions, export controls and other measures, and vowed to support Kyiv for as long as it takes.
articles.title: G7 confirms pledge to impose severe costs on Russia for Ukraine war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Protesters in Georgia's Russia-backed breakaway region of Abkhazia declined on Saturday to leave the parliament building which they stormed the previous day, a departure proposed by the region's president as a condition for resigning.
articles.title: In Georgian breakaway Abkhazia, protesters refuse to leave parliament

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines evacuated tens of thousands of people from their homes and cancelled dozens of flights on Saturday, as a super typhoon threatened to unleash heavy rains and powerful winds that could trigger floods and storm surges.
articles.title: Philippines evacuates tens of thousands as super typhoon Man-Yi nears

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A senior economic adviser to U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has said Britain should align itself with the United States on trade rather than pursue closer ties with the European Union.
articles.title: Britain should align with US on trade rather than pursue EU, says Trump aide

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) said on Friday it held constructive talks with authorities in Pakistan on economic policy and reform efforts to reduce vulnerabilities during an unscheduled staff visit.
articles.title: IMF, Pakistan wrap up unscheduled talks on $7 bln bailout

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Brazil has deployed troops, armored vehicles and naval ships to reinforce security around the summit of leaders from the Group of 20 major economies who meet on Monday and Tuesday at Rio de Janeiro's bayside Museum of Modern Art.
articles.title: Troops, armored cars and patrol boats protect G20 summit

articles.author: Tora Agarwala
articles.description: Authorities imposed an indefinite curfew in areas where protesters were besieging politicians' homes.
articles.title: Internet cut during protests in India's violence-hit Manipur state
